scopy.druglikeness.molproperty module¶

This moudle is used to calculated properise that contained in our collectded rules — up to now(2019.07.22), we have achived followed properties:

Molcular Weight >>> MW Molcular Volume >>> MolVol Molcular Density >>> Dense Formal Charge >>> fChar Number of bonds >>> nBond Number of atoms >>> nAtom Number of heteroatoms >>> nHet Number of heavy atom >>> nHev Number of rotable bonds >>> nRot Number of rigid bonds >>> nRig Number of SSSR >>> nRing logP >>> logP logD >>> logD logSw >>> logSw Acid or Base >>> ab pKa >>> pKa QED with average descriptor weights >>> QEDmean QED with maximal descriptor weights >>> QEDmax QED with using unit weights >>> QEDnone Molecular refraction >>> MR Number of hydrogen bond donors >>> nHD Number of hydrogen bond acceptors >>> nHA Number of hydrogen bond donors& acceptors >>> nHB Aromatic proportion >>> AP sp3 hybridized carbons/total carbon count >>> Fsp3 TPSA >>> TPSA Number of atoms involved in the biggest system ring >>> MaxRing Number of Sterocenterss >>> nStero HetCarbonRatio >>> HetRatio synthetic accessibility score >>> SAscore natural product-likeness score >>> NPscore Number of single bonds >>> nSingle Number of double bobds >>> nDouble Number of triple bonds >>> nTriple Number of Carbon atoms >>> nC Number of Boron atoms >>> nB Number of Chlorin atoms >>> nCl Number of Bromine atoms >>> nBr Number of Iodine atoms >>> nI Number of Phosphor atoms >>> P Number of Sulfur atoms >>> nS Number of Oxygen atoms >>> nO Number of Nitrogen atoms >>> nN

— Followed should be achieved in the future:

Number of Charged Groups

scopy.druglikeness.molproperty.CalculateFsp3(mol)[source]¶

Fsp3 (carbon bond saturation) is defined as the number of sp3 hybridized carbons / total carbon count. —->FSP3

scopy.druglikeness.molproperty.CalculateLogSw(mol)[source]¶

The logSw represents the logarithm of compounds water solubility computed by the ESOL method —->logSw Equation: Log(Sw) = 0.16-0.638*clogP-0.0062*MWT+0.066*RB-0.74*AP

>MWT: Molecular Weight >RB: Rotatable bonds >AP: Aromatic proportion

Delaney, John S. Journal of chemical information and computer sciences 44.3 (2004): 1000-1005.

mol: rdkit.Chem.rdchem.Mol

logSw: float

scopy.druglikeness.molproperty.CalculateMaxSizeSystemRing(mol)[source]¶

mol: rdkit.Chem.rdchem.Mol

MR: float

scopy.druglikeness.molproperty.CalculateMolVolume(mol)[source]¶

Calculation of Van der Waals Volume of molecule —->MolVol

for single atom: Vw = 4/3*pi*rw^3, the rw is the Van der Waals radius of atom VvdW = ∑(atom contributions)-5.92NB(Unit in Å^3), NB is the total number of bonds the Van der Waals radius of atom is derived from wikipedia.

mol: rdkit.Chem.rdchem.Mol

NPscore: float

mol: rdkit.Chem.rdchem.Mol

scopy.druglikeness.molproperty.CalculateQEDmax(mol)[source]¶

Calculation QED descriptor under different weights A descriptor a measure of drug-likeness based on the concept of desirability Here, calculating the QED descriptor using maximal descriptor weights. —->QEDmax

Bickerton, G. Richard, et al. Nat Chem, 4.2 (2012): 90.

mol: rdkit.Chem.rdchem.Mol

qed: float

scopy.druglikeness.molproperty.CalculateQEDmean(mol)[source]¶

Calculation QED descriptor under different weights A descriptor a measure of drug-likeness based on the concept of desirability Here, calculating the QED descriptor using average descriptor weights. —->QEDmean

Bickerton, G. Richard, et al. Nat Chem, 4.2 (2012): 90.

mol: rdkit.Chem.rdchem.Mol

qed: float

scopy.druglikeness.molproperty.GetIFG(mol)[source]¶

A function to compute functional groups in organic molecules

Ertl, Peter. J Cheminform, 9(1), 36. Based: https://github.com/rdkit/rdkit/tree/master/Contrib/IFG

mol: dkit.Chem.rdchem.Mol;

list of namedtuple, namedtuple(‘IFG’, [‘atomIds’, ‘atoms’, ‘type’]) e.g.:

[IFG(atomIds=(2,), atoms=’n’, type=’cnc’),

IFG(atomIds=(4, 5, 6, 7), atoms=’NS(=O)=O’, type=’cNS(c)(=O)=O’), IFG(atomIds=(12,), atoms=’N’, type=’cN’), IFG(atomIds=(15,), atoms=’n’, type=’cnc’)]

—

scopy.druglikeness.molproperty.GetProperties(mol)[source]¶

Get all properties in scopy

scopy.druglikeness.rulesfilter module¶

This module implments properties obtained from module molproperty — We have collected following rules:

Egan Rule 0<=tPSA<=132; -1<=logP<=6 Veber Rule nRot<= 10; tPSA<= 140; nHB<= 12 LipinskiRule MW<=500; logP<=5, nHD<=5, nHA <=10 BeyondRo5 Mw<=1000; -2<=logP<=10; nHD<=6, nHA<=15; tPSA<=250; nRot<=20 Pfizer Rule logP>3; PSA<75 GSK Rule MW<=400; logP<=4 OralMacrocycles MW<1000; logP<10; nHD<5; PSA<250 Oprea Rule nRing>=3,nRig>=18,nRot>=6 Ghose Rule -0.4<logP<5.6; 160<MW<480; 40<MR<130; 20<nAtom<70 Xu Rule nHD<=5; nHA <= 10; 3 <= rot <= 35; 1 <= nring <= 7; 10 <= nhev <= 50 Ro4 Rule MW<=400; logP<=4; nHD<=4; NHA<=8; PSA<=120 Ro3 Rule MW<=300; -3<=logP<=3; nHD<=3; nHA<=6; PSA<=60 Ro2 Rule MW<=200; logP<=2; nHD<=2; nHA<=4 REOS Rule 200<=MW<=500; -5<=logP<=5; nHD<=5; nHA<=10; nRot<=8; TPSA<=150; -4<=fChar<=4 GoldenTriangle — Followed should be achieved in the future:

OpreaTwo Rule: mw <= 450; -3.5<=clogP<=4.5; -4<=logD<=4; nring<= 4; no. of nonterminal single bonds<=10; nHD<=5; nHA<=8 Kelder Rule Schneider Rule DrugLikeOne DrugLikeTwo Zinc Cns Respiratory

scopy.druglikeness.rulesfilter.CheckBeyondRo5(mol, detail=False)[source]¶

Check molecular under beyond Ro5

Doak, Bradley C., et al. journal of medicinal chemistry 59.6 (2015): 2312-2327.

MW <= 1000 -2 <= logP <= 10 nHD <= 6 nHA <= 15 PSA <= 250 nRot <= 20

mol: rdkit.Chem.rdchem.Mol detail: bool(optional, default: False)

When set to True, function will return more information(the physicochemical properties mentioned in rule) else, only return Disposed and nViolated

checkres: namedtuple
if detail has been set to True, would be more specific, like:

bRo5Ruler(MW=180.16, logP=1.31, nHD=1, nHA=3, PSA=63.6, nRot=3, Disposed=True, nViolate=0)

else, only return ‘Disposed’ and ‘nViolate’, present obey(True) or not the rule and how any requirements has been violated respectively.

scopy.druglikeness.rulesfilter.CheckCNS(mol, detail=False)[source]¶

Check mol under CNS

Jeffrey, Phil, and Scott Summerfield. Neurobiol Dis, 37.1 (2010): 33-37.

135 <= weight <= 582 -0.2 <= logP <= 6.1 nha <= 5 nhd <= 3 3 <= TPSA <= 118

mol: rdkit.Chem.rdchem.Mol detail: bool(optional, default: False)

When set to True, function will return more information(the physicochemical properties mentioned in rule) else, only return Disposed and nViolated

checkres: namedtuple
if detail has been set to True, would be more specific, like:

CNS(MW=180.16, logP=1.31, nHD=1, nHA=3, tPSA=63.6, Disposed=True, nViolate=0)

else, only return ‘Disposed’ and ‘nViolate’, present obey(True) or not the rule and how any requirements has been violated respectively.

scopy.druglikeness.rulesfilter.CheckEganRule(mol, detail=False)[source]¶

Bad or Good oral biovailability rule

Egan, William J., Kenneth M. Merz, and John J. Baldwin. J Med Chem, 43.21 (2000): 3867-3877.

0 <= TPSA <= 132 -1 <= logP <=6

mol: rdkit.Chem.rdchem.Mol detail: bool(optional, default: False)

When set to True, function will return more information(the physicochemical properties mentioned in rule) else, only return Disposed and nViolated

checkres: namedtuple
if detail has been set to True, would be more specific, like:

bRo5Ruler(MW=180.16, logP=1.31, nHD=1, nHA=3, PSA=63.6, nRot=3, Disposed=True, nViolate=0)

else, only return ‘Disposed’ and ‘nViolate’, present obey(True) or not the rule and how any requirements has been violated respectively.

scopy.druglikeness.rulesfilter.CheckGSKRule(mol, detail=False)[source]¶

Check molecular under GSK rule(4/400 Rule)

Gleeson, M. Paul. Journal of medicinal chemistry 51.4 (2008): 817-834.

MW <= 400 logP <= 4

mol: rdkit.Chem.rdchem.Mol detail: bool(optional, default: False)

When set to True, function will return more information(the physicochemical properties mentioned in rule) else, only return Disposed and nViolated

checkres: namedtuple
if detail has been set to True, would be more specific, like:

GSKRuler(MW=180.16, logP=1.31, Disposed=True, nViolate=0)

else, only return ‘Disposed’ and ‘nViolate’, present obey(True) or not the rule and how any requirements has been violated respectively.

scopy.druglikeness.rulesfilter.CheckGhoseRule(mol, detail=False)[source]¶

Check molecular under Ghose rule

Ghose, Arup K., Vellarkad N. Viswanadhan, and John J. Wendoloski. Journal of combinatorial chemistry 1.1 (1999): 55-68.

-0.4 < logP < 5.6 160 < MW < 480 40 < MR< 130 20 < nAtom < 70

mol: rdkit.Chem.rdchem.Mol detail: bool(optional, default: False)

When set to True, function will return more information(the physicochemical properties mentioned in rule) else, only return Disposed and nViolated

checkres: namedtuple
if detail has been set to True, would be more specific, like:

GhoseRule(logP=1.31, MW=180.16, MR=44.71, nAtom=21, Disposed=True, nViolate=0)

else, only return ‘Disposed’ and ‘nViolate’, present obey(True) or not the rule and how any requirements has been violated respectively.

scopy.druglikeness.rulesfilter.CheckGoldenTriangle(mol, detail=False)[source]¶

Check molecular under ‘Golden Triangle’

Johnson, Ted W., Klaus R. Dress, and Martin Edwards. Bioorg Med Chem Lett, 19.19 (2009): 5560-5564.

200 <= MW <= 500 -2 <= logD <= 5

mol: rdkit.Chem.rdchem.Mol detail: bool(optional, default: False)

When set to True, function will return more information(the physicochemical properties mentioned in rule) else, only return Disposed and nViolated

checkres: namedtuple
if detail has been set to True, would be more specific, like:

GoldenTriangle(MW=180.16, logD=0.6117536115454374, Disposed=False, nViolate=1)

else, only return ‘Disposed’ and ‘nViolate’, present obey(True) or not the rule and how any requirements has been violated respectively.

scopy.druglikeness.rulesfilter.CheckKelderRule(mol, detail=False)[source]¶

Check moleculars under Kelder rules

-Ref.:

Kelder, Jan, et al. Pharm Res, 16.10 (1999): 1514-1519.

-Rule details:

tpsa <120 for orally active; tpsa < 60-70 for brain penetration

scopy.druglikeness.rulesfilter.CheckLipinskiRule(mol, detail=False)[source]¶

Check molecular under Lipinski’s rule

Lipinski, Christopher A., et al. Advanced drug delivery reviews 23.1-3 (1997): 3-25.

MW <= 500(Da) logP <= 5 nHD <= 5 nHA <= 10

mol: rdkit.Chem.rdchem.Mol detail: bool(optional, default: False)

When set to True, function will return more information(the physicochemical properties mentioned in rule) else, only return Disposed and nViolated

checkres: namedtuple
if detail has been set to True, would be more specific, like:

LipinskiRule(MW=180.16, logP=1.31, nHD=1, nHA=3, Disposed=True, nViolate=0)

else, only return ‘Disposed’ and ‘nViolate’, present obey(True) or not the rule and how any requirements has been violated respectively.

scopy.druglikeness.rulesfilter.CheckOpreaRule(mol, detail=False)[source]¶

Oprea, Tudor I. Journal of computer-aided molecular design 14.3 (2000): 251-264.

nRing >= 3 nRig >= 18 nRot >=6

mol: rdkit.Chem.rdchem.Mol detail: bool(optional, default: False)

When set to True, function will return more information(the physicochemical properties mentioned in rule) else, only return Disposed and nViolated

checkres: namedtuple
if detail has been set to True, would be more specific, like:

OpreaRule(nRing=1, nRig=8, nRot=3, Disposed=False, nViolate=3)

else, only return ‘Disposed’ and ‘nViolate’, present obey(True) or not the rule and how any requirements has been violated respectively.

scopy.druglikeness.rulesfilter.CheckOpreaTwoRule(mol)[source]¶

-Ref.:

-Rule details:

mw <= 450 -3.5 <= clogP <= 4.5 -4 <= logD <= 4 nring <= 4 no. of nonterminal single bonds<=10 #this property should be realized NHD <= 5 NHA <= 8

scopy.druglikeness.rulesfilter.CheckOralMacrocycles(mol, detail=False)[source]¶

Check molecular under oral macrocycles rules

Giordanetto, Fabrizio, and Jan Kihlberg. Journal of medicinal chemistry 57.2 (2013): 278-295.

MW < 1000(Da) logP < 10 nHD < 5 TPSA < 250

mol: rdkit.Chem.rdchem.Mol detail: bool(optional, default: False)

When set to True, function will return more information(the physicochemical properties mentioned in rule) else, only return Disposed and nViolated

checkres: namedtuple
if detail has been set to True, would be more specific, like:

OralMacrocycles(MW=180.16, logP=1.31, nHD=1, tPSA=63.6, Disposed=True, nViolate=0)

else, only return ‘Disposed’ and ‘nViolate’, present obey(True) or not the rule and how any requirements has been violated respectively.

logp > 3 TPSA < 75

When set to True, function will return more information(the physicochemical properties mentioned in rule) else, only return Disposed and nViolated

checkres: namedtuple

Check molecular under REOS program

Walters, W. Patrick, and Mark Namchuk. Nat Rev Drug Discov, 2.4 (2003): 259.

200 <= MW <= 500 -5 <= logP <= 5 nHD <= 5 nHA <= 10 nRot <= 8 TPSA <= 150 -4 <= fChar <= 4

mol: rdkit.Chem.rdchem.Mol detail: bool(optional, default: False)

When set to True, function will return more information(the physicochemical properties mentioned in rule) else, only return Disposed and nViolated

else, only return ‘Disposed’ and ‘nViolate’, present obey(True) or not the rule and how any requirements has been violated respectively.

scopy.druglikeness.rulesfilter.CheckRespiratory(mol, detail=False)[source]¶

Check mol under Respiratory

Ritchie, Timothy J., Christopher N. Luscombe, and Simon JF Macdonald. J Chem Inf Model, 49.4 (2009): 1025-1032.

240<=MW<= 520 -2.0<=logP<=4.7 6<=nHB<=12 51<=tPSA<=135 3<=nRot<=8 1<=nRing<=5

mol: rdkit.Chem.rdchem.Mol detail: bool(optional, default: False)

When set to True, function will return more information(the physicochemical properties mentioned in rule) else, only return Disposed and nViolated

checkres: namedtuple

Respiratory(MW=180.16, logP=1.31, nHB=4, tPSA=63.6, nRot=3, nRing=1, Disposed=False, nViolate=2)

else, only return ‘Disposed’ and ‘nViolate’, present obey(True) or not the rule and how any requirements has been violated respectively.

Check molecular under RO2

MW <= 200 Logp <= 2 NHD <= 2 NHA <= 4

else, only return ‘Disposed’ and ‘nViolate’, present obey(True) or not the rule and how any requirements has been violated respectively.

scopy.druglikeness.rulesfilter.CheckRo3(mol, detail=False)[source]¶

Check molecular under Ro3

Congreve, Miles, et al. Drug discovery today 19.8 (2003): 876-877.

MW <= 300 -3 <= logP <= 3 NHD <= 3 NHA <= 6 PSA <= 60

mol: rdkit.Chem.rdchem.Mol detail: bool(optional, default: False)

When set to True, function will return more information(the physicochemical properties mentioned in rule) else, only return Disposed and nViolated

checkres: namedtuple
if detail has been set to True, would be more specific, like:

Ro3(MW=180.16, logP=1.31, nHD=1, nHA=3, tPSA=63.6, nRot=3, Disposed=False, nViolate=1)

else, only return ‘Disposed’ and ‘nViolate’, present obey(True) or not the rule and how any requirements has been violated respectively.

scopy.druglikeness.rulesfilter.CheckRo4(mol, detail=False)[source]¶

MW <= 400 logP <= 4 nHD <= 4 nHA <= 8 TPSA <= 120

mol: rdkit.Chem.rdchem.Mol detail: bool(optional, default: False)

When set to True, function will return more information(the physicochemical properties mentioned in rule) else, only return Disposed and nViolated

checkres: namedtuple
if detail has been set to True, would be more specific, like:

Ro4(MW=180.16, logP=1.31, nHD=1, nHA=3, tPSA=63.6, Disposed=True, nViolate=0)

else, only return ‘Disposed’ and ‘nViolate’, present obey(True) or not the rule and how any requirements has been violated respectively.

scopy.druglikeness.rulesfilter.CheckSchneiderRule(mol)[source]¶

Check molecular under Schneider rule

Schneider, Nadine, et al. J Chem Inf Model, 48.3 (2008): 613-628.

Rule details:

mw > 230 nhd > 0 nha > 0 nrot > 0 nring > 0 mr > 40 ###################### Followed should be realized

functional groups > 0 molecular volume > 191

scopy.druglikeness.rulesfilter.CheckVeberRule(mol, detail=False)[source]¶

Bad or Good oral biovailability rule

Veber, Daniel F., et al. Journal of medicinal chemistry 45.12 (2002): 2615-2623.

nRot <= 10 TPSA <= 140 nHB <= 12

mol: rdkit.Chem.rdchem.Mol detail: bool(optional, default: False)

When set to True, function will return more information(the physicochemical properties mentioned in rule) else, only return Disposed and nViolated

checkres: namedtuple
if detail has been set to True, would be more specific, like:

VeberRuler(nRot=3, tPSA=63.6, nHB=4, Disposed=True, Violate=0)

else, only return ‘Disposed’ and ‘nViolate’, present obey(True) or not the rule and how any requirements has been violated respectively.

scopy.druglikeness.rulesfilter.CheckXuRule(mol, detail=False)[source]¶

Check molecular under Xu’s rule

nhd <= 5 nha <= 10 3 <= rot <= 35 1 <= nring <= 7 10 <= nhev <= 50

mol: rdkit.Chem.rdchem.Mol detail: bool(optional, default: False)

When set to True, function will return more information(the physicochemical properties mentioned in rule) else, only return Disposed and nViolated

checkres: namedtuple
if detail has been set to True, would be more specific, like:

XuRule(nHD=1, nHA=3, nRot=3, nRing=1, nHev=13, Disposed=True, Violate=0)

else, only return ‘Disposed’ and ‘nViolate’, present obey(True) or not the rule and how any requirements has been violated respectively.

scopy.druglikeness.rulesfilter.CheckZinc(mol)[source]¶

Check mol under ZINC

-Ref.:

Irwin, John J., and Brian K. Shoichet. J Chem Inf Model, 45.1 (2005): 177-182.

-Rule details:

60 <= weight <= 100 -4 <= logP <= 6 nha <= 11 nhd <= 6 TPSA <= 150 nrot <= 12 nrig <= 50 nring <= 7 maxring <= 12 ncarb >= 3 nhet >= 0 hetcar <= 2.0 ncharged <= 4 -4 <= totalchar <= 4 nstero <= 2

scopy.druglikeness.rulesfilter.Check_CustomizeRule(mol, prop_kws, closed_interval=True, detail=False)[source]¶

You could customize the rule with mostly properties ypu want.

mol: rdkit.Chem.rdchem.Mol prop_kws: dict

the keys of dict are properties you want to check; the values should be a tuple or list with two elements, present the left- and right-bounded respectively.

closed_interval: bool, optional(default=True)

True for using closed interval and False for opened interval

— Return:

a namedtuple namedtuple(‘CheckRes’,[‘Disposed’,’MatchedAtoms’,’MatchedNames’,’Endpoint’]), for detail=True; and namedtuple(‘CheckRes’,[‘Disposed’,’Endpoint’]) for False

scopy.druglikeness.rulesfilter.DrugLikeOne(mol)[source]¶

Based on Drug-Like Soft designed by FAFDrugs4(http://fafdrugs4.mti.univ-paris-diderot.fr/index.html)

Through combining several articles describing drugs’ physico-chemical properties and an in-house statistical analysis of drugs.

-Ref.:

(1) Lipinski, Christopher A., et al. Adv Drug Deliv Rev, 223.1-3 (1997): 3-25. (2) Oprea, Tudor I. J Comput Aided Mol Des, 14.3 (2000): 251-264. (3) Irwin, John J., and Brian K. Shoichet. J Chem Inf Model, 45.1 (2005): 177-182. (4) Oprea, Tudor I., et al. J Chem Inf Comput Sci, 41.5 (2001): 1308-1315. (5) Pihan, Emilie, et al. Bioinformatics, 28.11 (2012): 1540-1541.

-Rule details:

100 <= weight <= 600 -3 <= logP <= 6 nha <= 12 nhd <= 7 TPSA <= 180 nrot <= 11 nrig <= 30 nring <= 6 maxring <= 18 3 <= ncarb <=35 1 <= nhet <= 15 0.1 <= hetcar <=1.1 ncharged <= 4 -4 <= totalchar <= 4

scopy.druglikeness.rulesfilter.DrugLikeTwo(mol)[source]¶

Based on Drug-Like Soft designed by FAFDrugs4(http://fafdrugs4.mti.univ-paris-diderot.fr/index.html)

Through combining several articles describing drugs’ physico-chemical properties and an in-house statistical analysis of drugs.

-Ref.:

(1) Oprea, Tudor I., et al. J Comput Aided Mol Des, 14.3 (2000): 251-264. (2) Workman, Paul, and Ian Collins. Chem Biol, 17.6 (2010): 561-577. (3) Baell, Jonathan B. J Chem Inf Model, 53.1 (2012): 39-55. (4) Brenk, Ruth, et al. ChemMedChem 3.3 (2008): 435-444.

-Rule details:

150 <= weight <= 400 -3 <= logP <= 4 nha <= 7 nhd <= 4 TPSA <= 160 nrot <= 9 nrig <= 30 nring <= 4 maxring <= 18 3 <= ncarb <=35 1 <= nhet <= 15 0.1 <= hetcar <=1.1 ncharged <= 4 -4 <= totalchar <= 4 nstero <= 2
